Deprecated API

  • Deprecated Classes 
    Class and Description
    org.tribuo.common.tree.AbstractCARTTrainer.AbstractCARTTrainerProvenance
    org.tribuo.regression.baseline.DummyRegressionTrainer.DummyRegressionTrainerProvenance

  • Deprecated Fields 
    Field and Description
    org.tribuo.regression.RegressionFactory.UNKNOWN_MULTIPLE_REGRESSOR
    Deprecated when regression was made multidimensional by default. Use RegressionFactory.UNKNOWN_REGRESSOR instead.
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    org.tribuo.classification.sgd.crf.CRFModel.convert(SequenceExample<Label>, ImmutableFeatureMap, ImmutableOutputInfo<Label>)
    As it's replaced with CRFModel.convertToVector(org.tribuo.sequence.SequenceExample<T>, org.tribuo.ImmutableFeatureMap) which is more flexible.
    org.tribuo.classification.sgd.crf.CRFModel.convert(SequenceExample<T>, ImmutableFeatureMap)
    As it's replaced with CRFModel.convertToVector(org.tribuo.sequence.SequenceExample<T>, org.tribuo.ImmutableFeatureMap) which is more flexible.
    org.tribuo.data.columnar.RowProcessor.copy()
    In a future release this API will change, in the meantime this is the correct way to get a row processor with clean state.

    When using regexMappingProcessors, RowProcessor is stateful in a way that can sometimes make it fail the second time it is used. Concretely: 

         RowProcessor rp;
     Dataset ds1 = new MutableDataset(new CSVDataSource(csvfile1, rp));
     Dataset ds2 = new MutableDataset(new CSVDataSource(csvfile2, rp)); // this may fail due to state in rp
    This method returns a RowProcessor with clean state and the same configuration as this row processor.
    org.tribuo.common.xgboost.XGBoostExternalModel.createXGBoostModel(OutputFactory<T>, Map<String, Integer>, Map<T, Integer>, XGBoostOutputConverter<T>, Booster, URL)
    As the URL argument must always be valid. To wrap an in-memory booster use XGBoostExternalModel.createXGBoostModel(OutputFactory, Map, Map, XGBoostOutputConverter, Booster, Map).
    org.tribuo.common.libsvm.LibSVMModel.getModel()
    Deprecated to unify the names across LibLinear, LibSVM and XGBoost.
    org.tribuo.util.tokens.impl.SplitCharactersTokenizer.getSplitCharacters()
    org.tribuo.util.tokens.impl.SplitCharactersTokenizer.getSplitXDigitsCharacters()
    org.tribuo.util.tokens.impl.SplitCharactersTokenizer.isSplitCharacter(char)
    org.tribuo.util.tokens.impl.SplitCharactersTokenizer.isSplitXDigitCharacter(char)
    org.tribuo.regression.sgd.RegressionObjective.loss(DenseVector, SGDVector)
    In 4.1 to move to the new name, lossAndGradient.
    org.tribuo.regression.sgd.objectives.SquaredLoss.loss(DenseVector, SGDVector)
    org.tribuo.regression.sgd.objectives.Huber.loss(DenseVector, SGDVector)
    org.tribuo.regression.sgd.objectives.AbsoluteLoss.loss(DenseVector, SGDVector)
    org.tribuo.transform.TransformStatistics.observeSparse()
    in 4.1 as it's unnecessary.
    org.tribuo.transform.transformations.SimpleTransform.observeSparse()
    org.tribuo.data.columnar.ResponseProcessor.setFieldName(String)
    Response processors should be immutable; downstream objects assume that they are Set the field name this ResponseProcessor uses.
    org.tribuo.data.columnar.processors.response.QuartileResponseProcessor.setFieldName(String)
    org.tribuo.data.columnar.processors.response.FieldResponseProcessor.setFieldName(String)
    org.tribuo.data.columnar.processors.response.EmptyResponseProcessor.setFieldName(String)
    org.tribuo.data.columnar.processors.response.BinaryResponseProcessor.setFieldName(String)
    org.tribuo.classification.sgd.Util.shuffleInPlace(SparseVector[], int[], double[], SplittableRandom)
    In favour of AbstractSGDTrainer.shuffleInPlace(org.tribuo.math.la.SGDVector[], T[], double[], java.util.SplittableRandom).
    org.tribuo.math.la.SparseVector.toDenseArray()
    org.tribuo.classification.sgd.LabelObjective.valueAndGradient(int, SGDVector)
    In 4.1, to migrate to the new name LabelObjective.lossAndGradient(java.lang.Integer, org.tribuo.math.la.SGDVector).
    org.tribuo.classification.sgd.objectives.LogMulticlass.valueAndGradient(int, SGDVector)
    org.tribuo.classification.sgd.objectives.Hinge.valueAndGradient(int, SGDVector)
